expressions.usage: Used to express excitement or approval.
Used to reassure someone or downplay a problem.
Encourages someone to move faster or take action.
A casual way of asking how someone is doing.
Used to describe someone who is distracted or daydreaming.

expressions.meaning: To be a piece of bread.
expressions.usage: Refers to someone who is very kind or good-hearted.
Describes someone who is a little crazy or eccentric.
Encourages someone to get motivated or start working hard.
Refers to being in a bad mood.

expressions.expression: Tener la cabeza llena de pájaros.
expressions.meaning: To have a head full of birds.
expressions.usage: Describes someone who has unrealistic or naive ideas.
Means getting to the point of a conversation.
Means helping someone.

expressions.expression: No tener pelos en la lengua.
expressions.meaning: To not have hairs on the tongue.
expressions.usage: Describes someone who speaks very bluntly or honestly.
Means feeling very tired or exhausted.
Refers to something that is very easy to do.
Means joking around or teasing someone.
Describes someone who is not paying attention.
Refers to being nervous or shaky.
Means giving up on something.
Refers to someone who talks a lot.
Expressing resigned acceptance of an uncomfortable circumstance.
